casebody.data:
Akron Bar Association v. Peters.

[Cite as Akron Bar Assn. v. Peters, 100 Ohio St.3d 1205, 2003-Ohio-5415.]

(No. 2001-1560 Submitted September 26, 2003 Decided September 29, 2003.)

{¶ 1} This cause came on for further consideration upon the filing of an application for reinstatement by respondent, Cindy Virginia Peters, Attorney Registration No. 0021345, last known business address in Akron, Ohio.

{¶ 2} The court coming now to consider its order of January 30, 2003, wherein the court, pursuant to Gov.Bar R. V(6)(B)(3), suspended respondent for a period of two years with credit for time served under her interim felony suspension, finds that respondent has substantially complied with that order and with the provisions of Gov.Bar R. V(10)(A). Therefore,

{¶ 3} IT IS ORDERED by this court that respondent be and hereby is reinstated to the practice of law in the state of Ohio.

{¶ 4} IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Clerk of this court issue certified copies of this order as provided for in Gov.Bar R. V(8)(D)(1), that publication be made as provided for in Gov.Bar R. V(8)(D)(2), and that respondent bear the costs of publication.

{¶ 5} For earlier cases, see Akron Bar Assn. v. Peters (2002), 94 Ohio St.3d 215, 761 N.E.2d 1038; and In re Peters (2000), 89 Ohio St.3d 1403, 728 N.E.2d 1089.

Moyer, C.J., Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer, Lundberg Stratton, O’Connor and O’Donnell, JJ., concur.
